title: List of balls in Vienna
text:
The classic <a href="Vienna">Viennese</a> <a href="Ball%20%28dance%20party%29">ball</a> has a tradition stretching back over four centuries, and has even taken the first steps towards inclusion in the <a href="UNESCO%20Intangible%20Cultural%20Heritage%20Lists">UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Lists</a>. The full spectacle extends from the opening ceremony featuring a debutant's committee to midnight stage shows with dance and music performances. There is also traditional ball etiquette involved – from the "Damenspenden", a gift presented to the ladies, to the requisite <a href="gown">gown</a>, <a href="tuxedo">tuxedo</a>, or formal traditional <a href="Austrian%20dress">Austrian dress</a>, <a href="Austrian%20culture">Austrian culture</a> runs through every aspect of the Viennese ball.
Below is a list of balls in <a href="Vienna">Vienna</a>, capital of <a href="Austria">Austria</a>.
